We can interchange the order of summation because all terms are positive and thus converge: \[
\sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \sum_{j=2}^{2008} \frac{1}{j^k} = \sum_{j=2}^{2008} \sum_{k=2}^{\infty} \frac{1}{j^k}.
sentence-category-reason: Justifies interchanging summations based on positivity/convergence and states the reordered sums.
